bill_title: revise certain transportation and recordkeeping  requirements for ambulance services.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain transportation and recordkeeping requirements for ambulance services. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-11-7 be amended to read as follows: 34-11-7. Each operator shall record each trip on forms designated by the licensing agency and copies submitted to the department monthly. These records shall be maintained for a period of four years and upon request be made available to the department for inspection. The operator shall make the records available on request to immediate family members or guardians of the patient being transported and shall provide the reports within thirty days after the request. Section 2. That chapter 34-11 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any adult person who is to be transported by an ambulance or any parent or guardian of a minor who is to be transported by an ambulance may request that the person be transported to a specific medical facility or to a medical facility in a specific location. The ambulance driver shall transport the person to the requested location. The Department of Health shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to specify procedures and to provide release forms to implement the provisions of this section.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
